results.title: Keep clean, eyes open: your responsibility
results.creator_credit: J Lyons and Co and Terence Weathers
results.brief_description: A key to cleanliness film which deals with food poisoning in the home, in a shop, in a restaurant or in a factory. The film explains poisoning - concentrating on germs and makes some suggestions for prevention of contamination.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J Lyons and Co and Terence Weathers

results.title: Keep 'em in the fairway
results.brief_description: Highlights the five golf fundamentals which the Professional Golfers’ Association (PGA) believes essential to every good golf swing. Features golfers Bobby Jones, Sam Snead, Ben Hogan and others.

results.title: Keen as mustard
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly and Bridget Goodwin
results.brief_description: This program emphasises the age old axiom “don’t volunteer” following the top secret chemical warfare experiments conducted on Australian volunteers during World War II. Scientists, laboratory assistants and volunteers recount their horrific experiences with the Australian Chemical Warfare Unit and the mustard gas experiments amidst the tropical beauty of Northern Queensland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trevor Graham, Sharon Connolly and Bridget Goodwin

results.title: Keeling over
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and Greg Stitt
results.brief_description: Auckland’s Hauraki Gulf is one of the finest sailing areas in the world, and Bruce Farr is a New Zealand yacht designer with an international reputation. When two Farr yachts engage in three days racing over a course the scene is set for some spectacular sailing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Derek Wright and Greg Stitt

results.title: Keats Stories about Peter
results.brief_description: Goggles - Peter finds a pair of motorcycle goggles without lenses, but when he and Archie set off with their treasure they run into some big boys and trouble. “A Letter to Amy” - Peter wants to invite a girl to his birthday party so he writes her a special letter. “Peter’s Chair” - Angered by the attention given to his baby sister, Peter is ready to run away from home with his chair and other treasures.

results.title: Keating on Van Gogh
results.creator_credit: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, creates a composite picture in the style of Van Gogh and includes a portrait of the artist and sunflowers in the painting. He provides biographical details of Van Gogh, describes his physical appearance and the influence on his paintings of the Dutch Masters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes

results.title: Keating on Turner
results.creator_credit: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating shows how Turner, in his opinion, is the greatest of water colour artists. A reverse version of Turner’s famous work “The Fighting Temerara” is the subject of this program and we learn the techniques used by the artist to achieve the desired texture of the sky and the new Thames.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes
results.description:

results.title: Keating on Titian
results.creator_credit: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating discusses Titian’s early life and the artists who influenced his work. Keating recreates “Tarquin and Lucretia” taking the viewer through the various stages including scumbling, glazing and impasto.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes
results.description:

results.title: Keating on Restoration
results.creator_credit: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Fawkes and Richard Beighton
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, an English artist and television personality, demonstrates the art of restoring an old painting. He collects a century old “pot boiler” from his local pub and explains in detail the restoration process.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Fawkes and Richard Beighton

results.title: Keating on Renoir
results.creator_credit: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating paints a portrait using an artist’s model as his subject. He discusses Renoir’s limited palette, his influences and his eventual creation of a unique style of painting together with biographical details.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Moving Picture Company, Channel 4 Television Corporation, Richard Beighton and Richard Fawkes
